title: Special Military Programs and Agreements  · Angelo State University
description: Explore special military programs and agreements at Angelo State to support active-duty service members in their educational journey and career advancement.

headings: Air University Associate to Baccalaureate Cooperative (AU-ABC) Program
35N MOS Signals Intelligence Analyst Basic Analysis and Reporting Course
U.S. Navy’s Analysis and Reporting Course
paragraphs: As a military-friendly institution, we support multiple partnerships with military agencies to apply military training credit to an Angelo State degree.

An articulation agreement between Angelo State and the National Security Agency (NSA) allows NSA personnel to transfer their credits earned through the National Cryptologic University into nine different undergraduate and graduate degree and certificate programs, the majority of which are offered through ASU’s Department of Security Studies and Criminal Justice.
CYBR 3422-Students who complete the CYBR 3422 course can transfer 12 credit hours toward an online master’s degree in homeland security or intelligence and analysis.

The AU-ABC programallows you to complete your ASU bachelor’s degree online with no more than 60 additional credit hours (possibly as few as 31) if you have earned your Associate of Applied Science (A.A.S.) from the Community College of the Air Force (CCAF). The number of additional credits depends on the credits completed through CCAF and other colleges/universities.
Available Majors:

Students completing the U.S. Army’s 35N MOS Signals Intelligence Analyst Basic Analysis and Reporting Course (BARC) are eligible to receive up to 21 credit hours toward a bachelor’s degree in intelligence and analysis. These credits include INA 3302, 3303, 3304, 3305 and 4301, and BOR 3307 and 3309.
Degree Planning Worksheet

You must be seeking an ASU bachelor’s degree to receive these transfer credits, and should submit your Joint Services Transcript to Angelo State showing completion of the 35N. Emailadmissions@angelo.eduto request the 35N courses be applied to your transfer credits.

Students completing the U.S. Navy’s Analysis and Reporting Course (NARC) are eligible to receive up to 21 credit hours toward a bachelor’s degree in Intelligence and Analysis. These credits include INA 3302, 3303, 3304, 3305 and 4301, and BOR 3307 and 3309.
Degree Planning Worksheet

You must be seeking an ASU bachelor’s degree to receive these transfer credits, and should submit your Joint Services Transcript to Angelo State showing completion of the training. Emailadmissions@angelo.eduto request the U.S. Navy’s Analysis and Reporting courses be applied to your transfer credits.

Students completing the 17th Training Wing’s Intelligence Officer Course (14N) are eligible to receive up to 12 credit hours toward an online master’s degree in intelligence and analysis, global security studies or homeland security.
Articulation Agreement and Guide
For application information, please refer to thegraduate student admissions page. Request a transcript of your 14N courses be sent to theASU Department of Security Studies and Criminal Justice.

DoD personnel who have completed at least a Level II Certification under the Defense Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act can transfer DAU credits into ASU’s Master of Business Administration (MBA) degree program. Successful applicants will receive six graduate credit hours toward a MBA and can then complete the remainder of the degree program online.
DAU Course Information

For application information, please refer to thegraduate student admissions page. Request a copy of your ACE transcript showing DAU courses be sent to the College of Graduate Studies in order to receive credit.

Homeland Security-Students who complete a prescribed homeland security course track can transfer up to 66 credit hours toward a bachelor’s degree in border and homeland security, criminal justice, or intelligence and analysis.
Counterterrorism-Students who complete a prescribed counter-terrorism course track can transfer up to 42 credit hours toward a bachelor’s degree in criminal justice.
Spanish-Students who complete a prescribed set of Spanish courses can transfer up to 24 credit hours toward a bachelor’s degree in Spanish.
CYBR 3422-Students who complete the CYBR 3422 course can transfer 12 credit hours toward an online master’s degree in homeland security or intelligence and analysis.
Area Studies-Students who complete a prescribed set of Area Studies courses can transfer up to 12 credit hours toward an online master’s degree in global security studies.
CSED 3111-Students who complete the CSED 3111 cybersecurity course can transfer nine credit hours toward ASU’s undergraduate Certificate in Cybersecurity.
